column4: Hello , If I do apt-cache search opera I get 50+ results, and most of the dosn't have the word opera in it, why ?
This is very conditional
is there a way just search for the word "opera" nothing ells ? or starts with opera only
I'm running ubuntu 8.10 x64 and did a apr-get update before
have you searched via synaptic?
synaptic? .. I tried to search using the GUI too but about the same results , not as many but still non off them have the word opera in it
There seems to be no opera package in ubuntu repos
try this
okay , then I should get no results ;(
did you already install it?
that package won't appear in synaptic untill you install it
is there another way to search with apt ? like opera* or "opera" ?
There is no package for opera in the official repos
you should be able to just double click it and install
I'm going to do that :) kjust making my point that I can't trust the apt if I'm searching for a pkg :(
The package will appear once you install it, there are legal reasons why it is not in the official repo
okay,
a new question that, can't I narrow down a serch with apt ?
Currently this feature is being requested in ubuntu brainstorm.
okay cool
thanks for that help
